website_summaries.verdict: If your computer feels sluggish, this inexpensive RAM board is an easy way to make it a much more productive machine.
pros: Available in a wide range of GB configurations
Effective at improving performance across the board
cons: You will need to do the research to ensure that this RAM is compatible with your PC before you buy, or else you’re wasting time

customer_reviews.title: Great for adding to a Dell i7559
customer_reviews.text: This ram was placed into my Dell i7559 gaming laptop to expand the included 8gigs of ram to 16 gigs. The JEDEC timings of this RAM are 11,11,11,28 at 1.35V This ram perfectly matched the existing ram from Dell which is why I bought it. System performance is great and I now get dual channel ram. The existing ram in my Dell Inspiron i7559-763BLK was a Hynix 8GB HMT41GS6BFR8A PC3L 12800 1.35v
customer_reviews.author: MeTaLhEaD

customer_reviews.title: Works in a Synology DS1815+ NAS
customer_reviews.text: Synology does not appear to provide much guidance on memory selection. However, this module has worked for me in a Synology DS1815+ NAS.
customer_reviews.author: tech collector

customer_reviews.title: Solid RAM (look up install instructions online, nothing provided)
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to really review RAM, but I can certify that I popped this guy right in and it has made my previously 4GB computer so much better and usable. I would encourage anyone who buys a new computer to get some additional ram, look up online how to open your computer (not as easy as I thought) and then add it. It can very easily take what feels like a lemon and make it into a solid machine.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful upgrade to my HP Notebook - 15-ac027ds (that only ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful upgrade to my HP Notebook - 15-ac027ds (that only had 4 gig). I asked a question about this upgrade and got a 50/50 answer. A user has the same lappy I have and he mentioned it was a perfect match (and it is, I agree). while other feedback stated it was not compatible. I will say one thing in defense of the "not compatible" answer, taking apart this particular laptop is not for a newb. I suspect this was the reason for the reply. But, if you kow what you are doing and have this laptop - this memory chip is for you!!!! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: CDS

customer_reviews.title: works in 27 in retina iMac late 2014
customer_reviews.text: I have retina iMac late 2014 and through various articles was leery considering people reports of iMacs being finicky with what ram you put in it and whether or not you should install ram in pairs. My iMac came with 2x4gb modules and I only added one 8gb module (this kingston ram that I just bought). the mac recognizes and works with 16gb total now. no problems so far. will update if I run into issues down the line
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H

customer_reviews.title: Works with MSi Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I'm using a 2014 MSi GE 60 Apache laptop. It came with 8GB of Kingston RAM installed. These chips sold here (while on a green board; not blue like the chip the laptop shipped with) seemingly have the same specs. I installed this newly ordered chip a few minutes ago and the two chips work fine together. The machine is recognizing the full 16GB of RAM. Hope this helps any MSi laptop owners who have searched for the pre-installed Kingston MSi stickered chip but could not find it.
customer_reviews.author: Mario and Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop RAM
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add to thelaptop that I bought, as 4GB of memory doesn't really cut it these days. With memory, it's usually just drop it in and go, and that was the case with this stick for sure. Stuck it in the laptop, worked perfectly, good to go. It's inexpensive, and comes from one of the top RAM distributors (Kingston) and so comes with a good warranty. If your computer is running slow, adding RAM is a good option that could well get it running faster, so it's easy to recommend buying this for your laptop.
customer_reviews.author: D. Strout

customer_reviews.title: ) It works perfectly and was easy to do
customer_reviews.text: I bought this DDR3 DIMM to expand the RAM on my Synology D416play NAS from 1G to 8G. The installation was straightforward. I was able to disassemble, swap the DIMM, and reassemble without any issue. The NAS booted right up and the RAM is both recognized and in use (mostly as cache). System response is much more brisk. Throughput is 50-100% higher due to a big drop in IO wait (memory cache rather than swap on disk.) It works perfectly and was easy to do. If you are considering upgrading some hardware, and your research confirms that this DIMM will work, go for it. If you can get it installed, it should work for you. Very worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: wh33ls

customer_reviews.title: Good value RAM for HP Probook 6570b but benchmark is under average
customer_reviews.text: This RAM module is good for money with reasonable performance. PerformanceTest 9.0 score is 1491 with single 8GB ram module which is not too bad comparing to average score of 1748. If you don't want to spend too much but want to raise your old laptop to reasonable speed, this would be a good option to consider. If you would prefer pay more for better performance, then Hyperx 8GB x 2 would be a good option which reaches PerformanceTest 9.0 score of 2352.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Fits Dell Inspiron 3646
customer_reviews.text: So, the Dell Inspiron 3646 came with 4GB RAM, which was advertised as adequate to run Windows 10. It worked, so, cheapness won, and I left it alone for a few years. Then this deal came along on an 8GB stick, Kingston is a good name, so, what the heck? I SHOULD HAVE UPGRADED LONG AGO!!! BTW, I spent far more time cleaning the dust out of the chassis than I did installing the RAM.
customer_reviews.author: SanLeandroGuy

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with QNAP TS-251+
customer_reviews.text: I tried two of these in a QNAP TS-251+ and neither worked, either separately or together. I would think getting two bad memory sticks at the same time would be almost impossible. The only other reasons that they didn't work would be that they are just not compatible, or, they are improperly labeled. I replaced them with Crucial CT2KIT51264BF160B, which has the same specs, and they worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Hoo

customer_reviews.title: Faulty hardware
customer_reviews.text: My laptop started crashing after installing. Ran a memory diagnostic test and it came back as faulty hardware. Unfortunately, it is out of the return window at this point. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, cheap and easy!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this memory module to put in my Alienware Alpha. I received the product very quickly and was impressed by the simplicity of the packaging and the ease of installation. I immediately saw a noticeable difference in the performance of my machine. I am very pleased with this unit and for the price it can't be beat. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking for a good solution to adding a bit of performance to their machine at an affordable cost.
customer_reviews.author: Alltrades

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect in my early 2011 model Macbook pro 15"
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect in my early 2011 model Macbook pro 15". Even though most RAM is backward compatible, this ran full speed at 1600Mhz in my early 2011 model core i7 at 2.0Ghz. I am now able to develop software and test automation with vagrant. Adding virtual machines when I was only at 4GB of RAM made the system very sluggish and tested my patience. If you were considering this memory upgrade, I would also recommend pairing it with a solid state drive. It's like a brand new computer again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Ryan

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Ram
customer_reviews.text: My ASUS G750JM Laptop from 2014 had an extra off brand ram stick that got corrupted recently, and has made gaming more difficult. It got to the point where I couldn’t do anything for 10 minutes without crashing. So I opened up the Laptop and removed that ram stick and replaced it with this. All my computer issues are solved. If you’re deciding whether or not you should buy this ram stick, make sure your motherboard is compatible with this. (DDR3 L, 1600 MHz, 1.3v) Also another pro about this is that even though it’s a very easy process to install, it still comes with step by step instructions with pictures on how to install.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for Mom but could work for others.
customer_reviews.text: Came packaged well but unfortunately it didn't work in my Mom's laptop at all. One of my bffs is an IT person and she got all the info from Mom's laptop and said that this would work but it didn't. I tried it numerous times but the laptop would only power on with it installed, would not allow us to sign in or get into her laptop for daily usage. So I had to return it. I don't want to knock the product as it could work in others' laptops hence the 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: 80sRockerChicki

customer_reviews.title: Much better performance on my Inspiron 15R 5537 laptop
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my Dell Inspiron 15R 5537, I bought the laptop with 8 gigs of ram total. When I bought this memory I had hopes that the laptop had only one 8 gigabyte module (I didn't check), it turns out it has two 4 gigabyte modules. So when upgrading with this Kingston memory I was left with 12 gigabytes instead of 16 as there are just 2 sockets for RAM on the laptop. Nevertheless the laptop works much better, everything is smoother from desktop software to surfing the web. I am very surprised the difference that 4 gigs more can do. I will possibly buy another one in the future for even better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Mateo R.

customer_reviews.title: Great price, fair delivery time, excellent condition, fantastic product.
customer_reviews.text: I Love Kingston memory. It is high quality at a reasonable price. I've never had a bad chip. The package took a couple days to arrive, probably due to being shipped USPS, not Amazon quick but acceptable. It arrived in a shipping envelope in excellent condition and appropriately marked. For the price, I would use this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Another great purchase of Kingston memory at a great value.
customer_reviews.text: I've come to respect the quality of the Kingston brand. The fit and finish of the memory cards is perfect, no burrs, foreign material, scratches. I've used Kingston in the past on my other computers and never any problems. Many years of reliable performance. Well packed for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: 2012 IMAC 27". Added to the stock 8gb memory ...
customer_reviews.text: 2012 IMAC 27". Added to the stock 8gb memory, inserting into the two spare slots. Got a tone and would not boot. I had to move the two 4gb to the secondary slots and put these two 8gb in the slots the 4gb was in. Booted up with no issue recognizing 24GB total. Resolved my streaming issues with DirectTV Net over WiFi as I was previously getting low memory alerts that quality was being compromised.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H

customer_reviews.title: Solved the memory problem with my Lenova!
customer_reviews.text: Windows could not preform an update to the Lenova "cloud" laptop due to limited space. Fortunately, the laptop has space for a second drive, and this fit. Making it the C:\ drive, and moving the OS over to it in order to install the update was another matter. An experienced IT friend had to use special software to accomplish the task, and it was a challenge even for him.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: The RAM is great but beware of low quality laptops.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a very low end dell laptop. Big mistake! it ran like a dog. so i bought this Kingston RAM to increase performance. the RAM worked as expected but had the take that laptop apart to install the team. Just spend a bit more for a quality laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: No problem whatsoever once it got to me. Not the product's fault that Amazon messed up with delivery. I used it to upgrade a Windows 10 Pro ThinkPad T430 from 4GB to 8GB. That made a huge performance difference even though I was running an SSD main drive. Apparently a considerable amount of paging was occurring.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bushaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - Helped Revive a Dying Computer
customer_reviews.text: At my office building, we are given ancient pieces of technology to complete our work. I purchased this RAM stick to hopefully alleviate some of the slowness plaguing the desktop in the office. Easy to install, was cheap to purchase, and has done its purpose by speeding up the computer. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Marble

customer_reviews.title: Working Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about compatibility with my Dell Inspiron 15 5558 series laptop which is 4 yr old laptop, as i upgraded the to Windows 10, i started facing lot of slowness issue. With lot of research i found this 8gb version of RAM is good fit and i ordered. It's easy to install, thanks to Dell for it. RAM is perfectly working fine. Ordered another 1 again to make the full capacity of my laptops motherboard which supports 16GB max. hope to get soon..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent upgrade for older laptops, seems to work well with other sticks.
customer_reviews.text: Breathed new life into an old laptop. For reference, this laptop had 4 gigs of ram across two 2 GB ram sticks. I wanted to test if it would work with 6 gigs of ram; across this stick and one of the old ones--worked like a charm, and allowed me to run Autodesk AutoCAD with ease. I wouldn't be surprised if two of these sticks would really take care of any light use RAM deficiencies.
customer_reviews.author: Javi

customer_reviews.title: HP Envy X360 ram upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as expected on HP model # m6-w102dx. Kingston was actually the brand of ram already installed in the system. Just a word of warning if you're not familiar with taking apart electronics. This was one of the harder/ riskier upgrades I've done. Getting to the ram slots requires you to pull the motherboard. It took me about 20 mins from start to finish. I would expect closer to 30 mins if this is your first time taking apart a newer slim style laptop. Remember to be gentle and take your time. Finally; if you're going to be handling the motherboard please use a static wristband, it saves lives.
customer_reviews.author: James R. S. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: All good - as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a QNAP NAS. Install is not the most straight forward for the QNAP model I have (TS-251+), but once i got the drive cage out of the way the modules snapped in as expected. Recognized immediately on start-up, and a noticeable improvement over the 2gb the NAS shipped with. I'd suggest anyone buying a NAS consider topping out the memory at purchase time.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Well known brand at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: When I bought it, it was a good price on a recognized brand. Much more trustworthy than no name Chinese brands. Not a lot to recommend it over other brands. If it happens to be on sale, it's worth a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Lenovo E540
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect on the Lenovo E540 that came with 4GB. My memory usage widget went from a near-constant upper 60% range when running 4GB to low 30% - upper 20% range with this 4GB card installed. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: AdianB

customer_reviews.title: We've upgraded all our memory, and this stick does ...
customer_reviews.text: We've upgraded all our memory, and this stick does the trick. Add two, and you've got 16 GB of RAM. Make sure your computer is able to handle the added memory (that is step 1). I matched the type of memory to what was already inside the computer, more because I don't know whether different speeds would have worked so I chose to be safe rather than sorry. Perhaps some of the experts here can chime in if that is necessary. I simply matched 1600MHz, and DDR3L (which I think is low voltage, and for a laptop I think is smart). This is a straightforward product from a solid company.
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: Made my computer smarter
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to double the RAM in an Acer Aspire compact PC. It fits right and works fine. The only odd thing was that the sticker with the identifying info was on the opposite side of the card compared to the RAM that was already pre-installed, so that I can't see the info on the new card unless I remove its from its slot. For a second I thought the card might have been built backward, but that's not the case and the position of the sticker obviously doesn't affect its performance in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K

customer_reviews.title: Only one of two 4gb chips purchased worked
customer_reviews.text: On a relative's aging laptop I wanted to increase RAM from original 2gb to max 8 GB per specs, so I bought two of Kingston 4 GB chips. One worked, another didn't. I tried them as a pair and mixed with one of laptop's original 1gb chips. One of the Kingston 4 GB chips would not be recognized by the computer. I ended up installing the 4 GB that worked paired with one of the original 1gb chips, so now there is 5 GB of RAM instead of the intended 8 gb. Amazon refunded defective chip's purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Trusted brand
customer_reviews.text: Kingston has always been one of my go-to brands for memory. I've never been burned, they always work. That was the case here. My son's aging laptop was struggling to handle some new music software he was trying out, swapping itself to death with only 2g. Since he had an open slot, this was a cheap and easy bump, bringing it up to 6g. Once the swapping was gone, things ran much smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Montminy

customer_reviews.title: The Streak Continues
customer_reviews.text: My streak of success with Kingston memory modules continues after using this memory module in an HP Pavilion TouchSmart Sleekbook 14z-f000 laptop. The laptop itself is hard to upgrade. You literally have to take the whole thing apart to get to the memory slot. I tried a memory module of equal specs from ADATA and it did not work, so I knew it would be finicky. But this memory module by Kingston worked perfectly. Now my Sleekbook has an SSD drive and 8GB of RAM, and is easily twice as fast as when I bought it. Therefore I recommend this memory module and continue to recommend Kingston memory for easy do-it-yourself upgrades.
customer_reviews.author: IAMSLICK

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Kingston Memory with 100% Compatibility
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to upgrade the memory in my new Thinkpad 11e and it works perfectly with no hiccups. Have never had any problems with Kingston in the past and don't anticipate any with this either. There was a Crucial module for a few dollars less that said it could run at both 1.5V & 1.35V (the SODIMML standard). It left me wondering if it might be marginally approved for 1.35V operation so I went with one certified as SODIMML since it wasn't worth having any potential problems over a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Received item quickly, it works and seller was very communicative
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly and was as described. Seller was very communicative. I just now was able to get the RAM installed in my laptop since it was harder than it used to be with my old laptops. The whole thing had to come apart this time...darn you HP. In any case, the laptop picked up the RAM successfully, but I haven't noticed a huge improvement in speed just yet. Thought it would be more noticeable since I was doubling my RAM...
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Works great. This is for DDR3L application, as the label clearly states. Should pop right into the slot beneath your motherboard. I ordered 2, and used them to quadruple the memory of my laptop. It made an enormous difference in performance. Upgrading memory is the cheapest and easiest way to get a little more oomph from your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Domengo

customer_reviews.title: My laptop functions like a dream
customer_reviews.text: My laptop functions like a dream. I went from 4 GB to 8 by putting this memory in my laptop and then used the old 4 GB in another laptop to bump that one up from 4 to 8. Love my laptop with the expanded memory, no more hard drive caching. I can have many windows open at once. There have been no problems and I have been using my laptop continuously for months. Have used Kingston in the past and I am consistently pleased.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Kingston (along with Crucial) is the safest choice
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a problem with Kingston or Crucial RAM. They're both US companies and use high quality RAM chips in a true reference design. By comparison, most of the other brands, including G.Skill, Corsair, etc, are from Taiwan or China and seem to have more problems and source their RAM chips from wherever is cheapest. I run a memory test for 24 hours minimum on new PCs and new RAM upgrades. I've never had even the cheapest Kingston or Crucial memory fail but I've had several failures/incompatibilities with the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: EmbeddedFlyer

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Lenovo Ideapad Yoga 13
customer_reviews.text: One of my Lenovo Ideapad Yoga 13 was consistently giving the Win 8.1 BSD on every startup/ resume cycle. The accompanying error msg was PAGE_FAULT_IN_NONPAGED_AREA. It was traced to be a failing memory issue. Looking for a replacement, I found this DDR3L stick. Note that the 3L denotes 1.35V and the lower power rating allows for better battery life. Replacing was a snap (literally!). Enough tutorials/ youTube available based on the notebook model. Can't comment on the longevity yet (been less than a month, knock on wood), but thankfully the blue screen hasn't returned since and the computer seems to be running as good as before.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Just make sure it's the right voltage.
customer_reviews.text: I did not know that ram came in so many packages. This was especially true regarding low voltage ram. Originally I went to Best Buy and purchased an 8GB card at about double the price. When I installed it I found it did not work. When I brought it back they installed another one and the same problem. Their Geek Squad later said it was because my computer needed a "lower voltage ram," but that Best Buy does not have in stock. So I went home and purchased this on Amazon Prime. Got it in 2 days. Price was very good, and boy what a difference!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Greg

customer_reviews.title: Easy upgrade for sluggish laptop
customer_reviews.text: Simply & easy install for people with little or no experience performing surgery on laptops. Instantly improved the speed of Dell Inspiron 3147 -- remember to check compatibility with your own laptop before ordering, as RAM is not one size fits all. Would purchase Kingston brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was not disappointed!! Got exactly what I needed in this ...
customer_reviews.text: Silly me...bought a Dell laptop from Dell (nightmare!) that was 8 RAM upgradeable to 16 (which is what I needed). Bought one 8 RAM from Dell ($53) and realized I now only had 12. Needed to buy another 8 board ... but wasn't about to go back to Dell to get it - and needed it quick!! Was not disappointed!! Got exactly what I needed in this board in 2 days - and saved $20! If I had known that from the beginning, I would have just ordered 2 of these right from the get-go!! Good job Amazon and Kingston!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: The RAM works in my HP-2000 laptop with an Intel Core i3, 4GB of DDR3 1600MHz RAM before installing this, and Intel HD 4000 Graphics. I haven't noticed any improvements playing video games on my laptop, but with this installed, Chrome no longer uses 65% of my RAM just doing homework/watching videos online. If you're looking to upgrade RAM in your computer, do your research in the service manual to see what kind of memory it takes, and then look for that, but this is what matched the stock RAM in my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Stoney Bologna

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a year
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and upgrade but after 12 months I’m having memory issues and problem is with this stick. Maybe I got a bad one but it’s not fun tracking memory issues down.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Did what it should!
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly in a Dell notebook. Came well-packaged, and well-made. Was very easy to insert into the motherboard slot and locked into place perfectly, with no wobble/flex. The system immediately recognized it and never gave any errors.
customer_reviews.author: Random Buyer (An Actual Person!)

customer_reviews.title: Great Low Voltage RAM Solution
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my brother's Acer Aspire E-11 laptop, I looked into getting this to beef up the performance of the laptop I purchased for my brother, it's overkill for what he uses it for but I felt 4 GB was too small and I couldn't fit 2 sticks of 4 and 2 so the 1X8 was the only solution. Works great nonetheless, no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Never go wrong with Kingston RAM
customer_reviews.text: Solid, flawless memory every time. Took longer to shutdown the PC than it did to pop open where the RAM was hidden, pop out the old and snap in the new... booted right up and the RAM boost from 4GB to 16GB was phenomenal!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with HP Notebook 15
customer_reviews.text: Item (8GB of RAM) arrived very quickly (less than 24 hours) in a sealed plastic container within a bubble wrap envelope. Installation occurred easily and quickly; the HP Notebook 15 (a.k.a. X7T78UA or 15-ba009dx) immediately detected the RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Hornik

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to upgrade a friend's ASUS Q301L laptop from the 4gb soldered RAM to a total of 8gb. This ram upgrade worked perfectly. I didn't even have to boot into BIOS. Installed the chip, fastbooted to windows 10 and it recognized the extra 4gb stick no problems whatsoever. System is now reading a total of 8gb physical ram. Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: First it didn't work, now it does.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this 4GB RAM, Windows 8.1 does not recognize it, even after several tries. Finally, I gave up trying. This was in early 2015. Several months later today, on August, 2015, I decided to give it another try. This time I swap the chips on the RAM slots, placing the original one in the second slot and the new one in the first slot. For reasons unknown to me, Windows 8.1 now recognizes the extra 4GB. Now my PC is running with 8GB of RAM and much faster than before. Thank Goodness.
customer_reviews.author: Wen Tsen

customer_reviews.title: works great, will come back to this seller for the other 3 8GB i will be using in this IMAC.
customer_reviews.text: loaded it into the NEW IMAC, it works perfect. when they built this they placed into it, two 4gb instead of one 8GB like they should have. now i have 2 4GB, and 1 8GB, total of 16GB. the machine can max out at 32GB and i am taking up already 3 of the four slots. i will come back here and buy the other 3 8GB from this seller when i get the money, for sure. how can i not, the price is great, and getting a brand name.
customer_reviews.author: HHO

customer_reviews.title: Super simple worked right away
customer_reviews.text: Kingston is always the best. Following my manufacture's instructions the modules went right in after closing up the laptop I booted up and the 16GB was right there. My laptop is a Lenovo T530.
customer_reviews.author: Robert James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for my MacBook memory
customer_reviews.text: Picked this memory stick up to replace a failed stick in my 2012 MacBook Pro. Popped it in and my laptop was speeding along again, just as it should. Not much else to say about it except that it’s memory and it worked perfectly with my Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to increase the memory of my Synology 1515+ NAS unit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this memory to install into my Synology 1515+ NAS unit. Shipping was fast It was easy to install Worked perfectly in my NAS MUCH cheaper than buying a 4gb memory chip directly from the NAS manufacture. If you want to increase the memory of your Synology NAS, this memory chip is your answer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Life Warranty - Quality Laptop Memory module
customer_reviews.text: Works great - fairly ease to install in the spare slot of my MSI Laptop (matching the MSI branded Kingston SODIMM module that came with laptop) - nice memory boost by enabling dual channel mode (only single channel mode with one memory module). Check to make sure if you need DDR3L (1.35 Volts) memory modules for your laptop - generally want to match what you currently have installed unless you are replacing everything.
customer_reviews.author: Barry L. Beal

customer_reviews.title: Kingston Technology 8GB 1600MHz DDR3L  - Working like a charm - Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great product so far and arrived on time. Easy to install, laptop accepted the RAM upgrade without issues. Definitely a speed improvement for my laptop! Happy with this purchase. -
customer_reviews.author: ⪨MIND ⪨⪨🎵⪩⪩ PRIME⪩

customer_reviews.title: Works - No Issues so far
customer_reviews.text: I added more memory to my laytop, I have had no issues with these chips. I highly recommend this brand and product.
customer_reviews.author: Sono-sanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Much better now, the hard drive used to be active ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to turn a 1GHz Celeron laptop running Windows 8.1 on 4GB into a more bearable work machine for student.. Much better now, the hard drive used to be active 80% of the time due to paging, and that's only with a few tabs open, with Ms Word and Adobe.. everything was laggy and it was frustrating to work with. Anyways the packaging is solid, and memtest passed no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lai

customer_reviews.title: Worked in my Dell Inspiron 7000
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly in my new Dell Inspiron 7000 series! The new memory is the same clock speed 1600MHz and type DDR3L as what I had. The memory card popped into place with virtually no force. When I rebooted my laptop, the BIOS gave me a message that said something to the effect, "The memory amount has changed. If you did not change a memory card, something may be wrong." I now have 16gb of memory in my laptop!
customer_reviews.author: Danno2u

customer_reviews.title: Night and Day Difference in Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: The first memory brand I bought for my computer (and also the most expensive) back in 1995. Having two 16's in our Dell laptop has made a night and day difference with response time. I'm really glad I spent the extra for a brand I've always had good luck with.
customer_reviews.author: Ink Vine

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Synology NAS!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this RAM to use in my Synology DS1815+ and the unit immediately recognized the additional RAM and didn't give me any issues or problems what so ever. I can't speak about laptop use but as long as your device takes the same size as this then you should be set! Great purchase, especially for a inexpensive upgrade to a NAS!
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Bought wrong sticks
customer_reviews.text: I swear the product image was 240 pin when I ordered & not these short laptop sticks, maybe I'm losing it lol. Had asked a ? before I bought it month or so ago, Kingston replied in an email that 2 8 GB sticks would work in my HP Slimline 260-a101z with AMD A6 processor. So I'm returning them & try again.
customer_reviews.author: Gringo A La Carte

customer_reviews.title: was running 4 gigs of memory on an Acer Aspire ...
customer_reviews.text: was running 4 gigs of memory on an Acer Aspire 7560 at 1333MHz, a little on the slow side, but placing two of these in, now my computer runs as smooth as melted butter. Reason I placed 4 stars is because I bought two of the same chip at different times, but the chips aren't exactly matching colors... Wonder what's that all about... Hopefully no problems with them running in my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Received in good condition and in good time
customer_reviews.text: i was worried that product might not work with my model but it was compatible just as the advice on the check compatibility said. looking forward to ordering another in the future. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still using it to this day.
customer_reviews.text: Still writing on the same machine I used it in to this day. This memory is a great upgrade for a Dell Inspiron N7110.
customer_reviews.author: Technologic

customer_reviews.title: More memory added to my computer
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly and in good condition. No issues, works great and now my computer runs a lot faster!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent memory for Asus Zenbook
customer_reviews.text: This memory works great! Upgraded the 2GB stick in my Asus Zenbook UX302LA to this and now have 10GB RAM (Zenbook comes with 2GB on-board and a 2GB removable stick). If you have a Zenbook make sure you get this kind with the L after DDR3, L stands for low voltage which Asus Zenbook requires.
customer_reviews.author: KoolCat

customer_reviews.title: High Quality - Works Like a Charm!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace the memory inside of a brand new HP touchscreen laptop that originally came with only a 4GB memory card (not sufficient to run Windows 10). This is a great product, high quality, and I have had no issues with it whatsoever. Nothing else to say, other than it works like a charm and is exactly what I needed! Thanks for a high-quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive good memory!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to upgrade my sisters Dell Insprion 15. It was easy to install (because of the computer) and it worked as expected. I would recommend it for anyone wanting to upgrade memory in their computer.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Galliart

customer_reviews.title: Works with Intel NUC5i5RYH
customer_reviews.text: Installed two DIMMs in an Intel NUC (NUC5i5RYH) and it started flawlessly. (This SKU is on the Intel compatibility list, so I wasn't surprised. I tried a couple different DDR3 SODIMMs from an old laptop and neither worked.) I'll update my review if I encounter any performance issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Savvy

customer_reviews.title: I always turn to Kingston!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It's DDR3L RAM. Needed to upgrade to 8GB of RAM because the A8-6410 was hogging half a gig for VRAM. It worked great in my Toshiba C55D-B5203. The A8-6410 sure enjoyed doubling the VRAM to 1024MB. GTA V sure loved it as well. The system itself is much more response. Waking from sleep is now less then a second while with the original 4GB, it took 4 seconds! That title is a little misleading to us AMD APU owners. I wish Amazon would be more aware of it.
customer_reviews.author: Rhett

customer_reviews.title: Good chip
customer_reviews.text: CPU recognized it just fine. I have 32gb RAM. I barely use half of that as I use my laptop now. That being said, I have not noticed any serious speed increase except for the fact that my games load faster. They don't play any smoother though. Overall, my experience with Kingston has always been positive and they haven't let me down yet.
customer_reviews.author: scin77

customer_reviews.title: Easy upgrade worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install, just popped it in and now multitasking is much smoother. I went from 6 to 16 gb and it breathed new life into my 3 year old laptop, a Lenovo Z40-70. I can run Photoshop and a browser easily now when trying to do both slowed me to a crawl before.
customer_reviews.author: Jane of the Jungle

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat and a noticible improvement
customer_reviews.text: As usual- Kingston memory and Amazon come through again! Hard to beat Kingston's unconditional lifetime warranty (which I've used in the past and never had any problems) Added to my new HP laptop to make up a total of 16gigs of RAM! Runs perceptively faster now with the additional 8gigs... good deal! good price, fast PRIME shipping made it here fast- I ordered on a Wed night- got here that Fri afternoon- less than 48hrs!
customer_reviews.author: PowderMonkey

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! I bought a new laptop computer a while ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I bought a new laptop computer a while back and hated it from the very beginning, it was so slow I never even used it. This tripled my memory and immediately made it usable. Awesome! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kerriberri81

customer_reviews.title: Brought Life back to Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful way to bring new life back to an older laptop. Dell Latitude 3540, now RAM maxed at 8GB and both Windows and Ubuntu are running much faster. Easy to install, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: J. Isreal

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Plugged this into an Toshiba Satellite C55 after investigating what type of memory I have in there (I used a software called HWmonitor for this purpose) and fired right away: 8Gb on Windows 8.1 x64 really helps! IMHO there are 2 upgrades a laptop will benefit most from, in order: - replace HDD with an SSD; - upgrade from 4Gb to 8Gb if you have an x64 OS; Maybe it looks a bit pricey, but it works fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeFromRo

customer_reviews.title: Quick system boost
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item, quick system performance boost Will, and have recommended to others
customer_reviews.author: John C. Mims

customer_reviews.title: Easy upgrade
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this RAM matching the specs of the computer, and it allowed us to max out the memory. It really helped the overall performance of the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: The memory works just fine, my problem is they sent a different model ...
customer_reviews.text: The memory works just fine, my problem is they sent a different model than was shown so my motherboard won't work in the twice as fast duel channel memory mode. I ordered what I thought was a matching mem stick and got a different model instead.
customer_reviews.author: mckgarth

customer_reviews.title: improved performance
customer_reviews.text: Good performance increase in laptop after install. Went with memory & hard drive upgrade at once & found no issues with this RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the purpose of my. I bought two of them and thus was able to upgrade the RAM to 16GB, which was actually recognized by the device! This saved me a lot of money and it doubled what is officially supported on that model!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded Dell Inspiron i5-3531 to 8GB ram
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Just installed on a Dell Inspiron i5-3531 despite Dell specs saying 4GB ram max.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Boom Boom

customer_reviews.title: Works on 2010 Intel i5 iMac - max DRAM 16Gb
customer_reviews.text: It's memory. It works in a 2010-era iMac (i5), which has a max memory of 16Gb. Easy to replace. The processors in these are still fine, even at 2.4GHz or whatever, so doubling the memory makes the thing hum again, even running OS X Yosemite.
customer_reviews.author: S. McGeady

customer_reviews.title: Compatible - cheap upgrade to get the most of my laptop
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and boosted my laptop. Fully compatible with my Acer R7 laptop and tripled the computing speed. Cheap upgrade to completely ramp up my laptop making it much, much faster than the factory specs. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: B. Fifield

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine but ultimately not helpful
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine and was easy to install after I watched a couple of Youtube videos. That said, I did not see any improvement in my laptop's performance. After doing some more research, I found that my laptop's CPU is very week. So increasing the RAM was maybe not a wise move.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ACER 510 Laptop much faster with 8GB than standard 4GB
customer_reviews.text: Needed this in an ACER 510 laptop. The laptop only has a single memory slot, so to upgrade from Std. 4 GB to 8 GB requires replacement of the 4 with an 8. Using this memory, the upgrade was easy. Loosen one screw, lift up the plastic, expose the memory slot, unclick the SODIMM holders on each side, remove the 4 GB, insert the 8 GB, press the cover back on the laptop tighten the screw, turn it over, and voila, it boots perfectly, now with 8 GB, and it's MUCH faster.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Rogers JGT

customer_reviews.title: Booted up and recognized the memory on the first try and has been working great since then
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a co-workers HP laptop as an upgrade. Booted up and recognized the memory on the first try and has been working great since then.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. Ordered this for my Sony Vaio which had ...
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. Ordered this for my Sony Vaio which had 4GB memory installed on purchase. The card came in its own packaging by Kingston. Installation was a breeze, took only couple of minutes. The laptop has two slots, slipped the card in the empty one and it fit in with a small click. Powered up the laptop and new memory card was recognized instantly. The difference with the added the memory (8GB now) was immediately noticeable, programs are running much faster and smoother now. Have tried other products from Kingston and never had any issue. Same for this RAM card. In fact this card is also recommended by Sony for its laptops. Running perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: N Hasan

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: If you own a HP 300-030 mini this is the up grade for!!! I went from 4 GB to this 8 and you can see the difference in speed and no programs closing for lack of memory. When i up graded to windows 10 for free i started having lack of memory problems .This 8 GB solved the problem. And here is the best thing of all Kingston gives you a life time warranty!!
customer_reviews.author: EdandNeyra

customer_reviews.title: As advertised. No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine in an older Dell laptop that I needed to upgrade in order to use it effectively as a dedicated music computer connected to an amplifier and speakers. I haven't run any benchmark tests but this seemed to improve the performance of the laptop. It installed without a hitch and was readily recognized by the system.
customer_reviews.author: Obi Wan

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: What I liked is that this order arrived very quickly and was very easy to install. My computer is zipping along faster than before and loaded up way faster than before the installation. I would order from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy N. Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Virtually flawless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stick of memory as an upgrade for my HP Envy 15t laptop. Installing it was a breeze, and once I booted up the operating system automtically recognized it. Would recommend to anyone looking to add more RAM to his/her laptop!
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and gave my computer the extra Ram it needed. Went from 4gb ram to 8gb.
customer_reviews.author: oldskool

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I removed a 4gig stick and replaced with this 8gig to bring my machine from 12gig to 16gig. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky D. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Lenovo 11e replacement memory
customer_reviews.text: Works fine in my Lenovo 11e. I upgraded the following chipset : Samsung 4GB PC3-12800 DDR3-1600MHz non-ECC Unbuffered CL11 204-Pin SoDimm 1.35V Low Voltage Single Rank Memory Module Mfr P/N M471B5173DB0-YKO
customer_reviews.author: VitaTTop Contributor: Sunglasses

customer_reviews.title: Failed Memtest and caused blue screens on Windows 8.1
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work at all. I placed the product in my device and instantly started to get blue screens. After completing a Memtest on the RAM stick, it failed miserably. Mine could have been one of the few that failed or this could be signs of bad products, but I will not purchase this set again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dorman

customer_reviews.title: Great ram for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, it came packaged exactly like this and works exactly like it says it does. No problem at all. I haven't ever had a problem with Kingston products so that is why I would recommend them to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brentley I.

product_meta.title: Kingston Technology KVR16LS11/8 8GB 1600MHz DDR3L (PC3-12800) 1.35V Non-ECC CL11 SODIMM Intel Laptop Memory
product_meta.description: Capacity:8GBKingston is the industry leader in PC memory. Kingston is your best source for system specific memory. Included in the package is one 8GB module of select Intel Laptop Memory. Specs are 204 pin unbuffered Non ECC Low Voltage SODIMM. Standard 1G X 64 Non ECC 1600MHz 204 pin Unbuffered SODIMM (DDR3L, 1.35V, CL11, FBGA, Gold).
feature_bullets: One 8GB module of 1600MHz DDR3 laptop Memory
Backed by a lifetime and free technical support
From the industry leader in PC memory
